author: barnabasbusa
content:
ğŸ  Introducing [Consensoor](https://github.com/ethpandaops/consensoor)- A Python Consensus Layer Client

  I am excited to share consensoor, a brand new Python-based Ethereum consensus layer client! This is very much a work-in-progress, but it's already capable of participating in devnets. On its own ğŸ˜‚ 

  **What it can do**

  Over the past week, we've (claude and me ğŸ˜‚ ) implemented:

 - Block production - Proposes blocks when assigned as proposer
 - Attestation production & aggregation - Creates and aggregates attestations with Electra format support
 - Sync committee contributions - Participates in sync committees
 - P2P networking - libp2p with gossipsub for block/attestation propagation
 - Engine API integration - Full EL communication (forkchoiceUpdated, getPayload, newPayload)
 - Checkpoint sync - Syncs state from upstream beacon node
 - Validator key loading - [EIP-2335](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2335) keystore support
 - LevelDB persistence - Stores states and blocks across restarts
 - Beacon API - Implements subset of standard endpoints (enough for Dora compatibility)
 - Multi-fork support - Phase0 â†’ Altair â†’ Bellatrix â†’ Capella â†’ Deneb â†’ Electra â†’ Fulu â†’ Gloas
 - WIP GLOAS/ePBS - Early implementation of [EIP-7732](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7732) with SignedExecutionPayloadEnvelope broadcast
 - Prometheus metrics - For monitoring

The sad part: py-libp2p limitations ğŸ˜¢

  Unfortunately, py-libp2p has significant interop issues with production clients. Gossipsub mesh management is unreliable - we've seen blocks
  delivered inconsistently, causing fork divergence from other clients. The req/resp protocol works (Status, Ping, Metadata), but we can't rely on gossip alone for staying in sync.

  This is a known limitation of the Python libp2p ecosystem and honestly not sure if there is any hot fixes for this. 

  Primary goal: Testing

  This is NOT intended for testnets or mainnet. Performance is... let's say "not great" ğŸ™ƒ

author: barnabasbusa
content:
But it handles minimal preset (8 slots/epoch, 6s slot time) well enough for local Kurtosis devnets. It's designed for:
 
Rapid prototyping of new features
Testing spec changes (like GLOAS/ePBS)
Educational purposes
Local devnet experiments
